Professional Summary

Four years of experience implementing various applications on images (partially on signals) like OCR, Object Detection,
Face Detection (Recognition), Segmentation, Noise Removal, Texture Analysis, and Streaming Optimization, using the
advantages of deep-learning and machine-learning-based approaches in companies and on different projects.

These developing experiences were sometimes accompanied by the responsibility of being the product owner of the
projects from zero to the sale state; this gave me valuable insights into unpredictable challenges on the path of evolution.

The aforementioned projects are primarily deployed with the Python programming language; some others are with C++
and Matlab, especially those academic ones.

Employment History

Deep-Learning and Machine-Learning Researcher/Developer
Product Owner/Manager
@ Part AI research center
Tehran, Iran
Sep. 2018 – current
    Role: Researcher, developer, product manager, and supervisor of the vision team, focused on implementing
    deep-learning and machine-learning-based applications.

  • Farashenasa: (position: main developer)
    • Description: Farashenasa is Iran's most reliable and extensive remote authentication service. So far, over 8 million
    Iranian people have been authenticated using this platform. This system contains several significant attributes such
    as Identity Confirmation (Face Detection-Verification, Signature Detection-Segmentation, and Fingerprint Discriminator,
    Magnifier, Noise-Removal, Pattern Verification), Liveness(Texture Analysis), and Awareness(Gesture, Speaking Detection,
    and Head Pose Estimation).
    Keywords: Python, YOLO-V5, YOLO-V5-face, ArcFace, WHENet, Tina Face, BiSeNet V2, PP-Lite, Cycle GAN

  • Icup (Credit Card Processing): (position : main developer/product owner)
    • Description: Icup is a comprehensive super-application for financial markets, banking services, and online payments.
    Multiple computer vision applications for Credit and National Card processing (Corner Detection, Object Detection,
    Segmentation, and OCR) were developed with considerable optimization policies. Today, Icup has more than 500.000
    active users.
    Keywords: Python, YOLO-V5, (Our) Corner Detection, Alignment, PaddeleOCR, SimpleHTR, Pruning, Quantization, ONNX

  • Sepehr: (position: main developer)
    • Description: Sepehr is an internal organization monitoring service. This system currently uses Person/Face Identification,
    Attendance Confirmation, Tracking, Action Recognition, and Violations Detection.
    Keywords: Python, Tensorrt, Parallelism and Concurrency, FastMOT, WiderFace, Super Resoloution

  • Sepahtan: (position: developer)
    • Description: Sepahtan is a software product for transportation safety, autonomous driving, and recording traffic violations.
    Car Detection and Colour Recognition, License Plate Detection and Recognition, Speed Detection, Front Collision Warning,
    Road Signs Scanning, and Lane Deviation Warning are samples of used AI services. In this project, several hardware-specific
    optimization algorithms have also been utilized beside a particular embedded processor (Jetson Xavier).
    Keywords: Python, ONNX-runtime, Vision Classic, Byte Track, YOLO-V5, Attention (CBAM)

  • Real-time Streaming: (position: developer)
    • Description: For many of the services mentioned above, we needed real-time video streaming and processing; in addition,
    we could also have multiple input camera resources. In this situation, the time of rendering the videos (cost of reading and
    writing the frames) and processing each frame was vital in services. Therefore, we optimized our applications’ algorithms with
    state-of-the-art streaming facilities like G-Streamer, DL-Stream, Deep-Stream, and Nvidia-Dali. Each is designed to optimize
    processing time in particular CPUs and GPUs.
    Keywords: C++, Python, Deep-Stream, G-Streamer, Nvidia-Dali, DL-Stream
